summary: This document is a Deutsche Bank alert regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting his status as a registered sex offender and detailing various legal issues he has faced, including convictions for soliciting prostitution and other offenses. It includes multiple references to his addresses and aliases, as well as a summary of his criminal history and recent legal events. This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting critical risk factors associated with his financial activities. It references various media articles discussing Epstein's connections, particularly with Prince Andrew, and the implications of these relationships in the context of legal and public scrutiny. This document contains a series of alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting various media articles related to his legal issues and allegations of sexual misconduct. It includes references to lawsuits, plea deals, and Epstein's connections to high-profile individuals, particularly in the context of underage sex trafficking allegations.

events.title: Conviction for Soliciting Minors
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting minors for prostitution and was convicted, serving 13 months in jail.

events.title: Served Jail Time
events.description: Epstein served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation and registered as a sex offender.

events.title: Listed on New York Sex Offenders Site
events.description: Epstein appeared on the New York Sex Offenders site.

events.title: Conviction for Postal Fraud
events.description: Epstein was convicted of postal fraud for stealing his neighbor's mail.

events.title: Indicted for Solicitation of Prostitution
events.description: Epstein was indicted on a charge of felony solicitation of prostitution.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a registered sex offender since 2008 after pleading guilty to soliciting prostitution.
He served 13 months in jail for soliciting minors for prostitution.
By 2011, 40 underage girls had come forward with allegations of sexual assault against Epstein.
Epstein has made 17 out-of-court settlements as of May 2013.
The document includes multiple addresses associated with Epstein, indicating his extensive real estate holdings.
Jeffrey Epstein is flagged by Deutsche Bank as a critical risk entity.
Multiple media articles discuss the implications of Prince Andrew's friendship with Epstein.
There are allegations regarding Epstein's involvement in sexual offenses and the impact on Prince Andrew's reputation.
The document references various articles from different media outlets discussing the Epstein case and its ramifications.
Jeffrey Epstein is under critical monitoring by Deutsche Bank as of September 11, 2018.
Multiple media articles are referenced, detailing Epstein's legal troubles and connections to underage girls.
The document highlights various lawsuits filed against Epstein, including claims of sexual abuse and trafficking.
Epstein's plea deal and its implications are discussed in several articles referenced in the document.
The document indicates that Epstein's connections to high-profile individuals, including members of royalty, are under scrutiny.
